column4: do you actually have a problem with something not working in ubuntu?  IF SO then just state the problem, and leave the windows and dual boot talk at the door, none of that has any weight in resolving your issue
I wouldnt even worry about the brand, who cares what it is, he prolly means HP, why dwell on something so trivial.

what I'm saying is very simple in the same computer, I can have dual boot with WinXP Pro and Ubuntu 7.04 with no problems in none of the OS's, but when I try dual booting Vista with Ubuntu 7.04, I got problems in Ubuntu such as no sound, no wireless, etc..what's not to understand? :s
so could you please pastebin the output of 'lspci' 'iwconfig' 'ifconfig' to pastebin.
